metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000140 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: rsyslog librelp version 1.2.14 and earlier contains a Buffer Overflow vulnerability in the checking of x509 certificates from a peer that can result in Remote code execution. This attack appear to be exploitable a remote attacker that can connect to rsyslog and trigger a stack buffer overflow by sending a specially crafted x509 certificate.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> only used by rsyslog-relp packages in trusty, which is in universe.

criterions.comment: librelp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
